title: Israeli forces launch air strike on Gaza, explosions reported
description: The military operation, announced on Twitter, has led to reports of warplanes and explosions across Gaza.

title: US Supreme Court rules in favour of transgender track runner
description: The decision comes amid a proliferation of anti-trans rights bills promoted by Republican lawmakers across the country.

title: Sudan’s pro-democracy activists mark anniversary with protests
description: New delay to signing of deal to restore the military-to-civilian transition prompted fresh protests.

title: Can Europe persuade China to change course on Russia-Ukraine war?
description: France's president and the head of the European Commission hold talks with President Xi Jinping in Beijing.

title: Justice Clarence Thomas failed to disclose luxury trips: Report
description: ProPublica says the US Supreme Court justice did not report travel offered by a donor, in possible violation of law.

title: Biden administration defends Afghanistan withdrawal, blames Trump
description: White House says while Joe Biden wanted to end war, lack of planning by Donald Trump 'significantly limited' options.

title: Risk of hunger, poverty higher due to slow economic growth: IMF
description: Advanced economies face challenges of high inflation, poorer nations burdened by debt, IMF head says.

title: Canada repatriating 14 citizens from detention camps in Syria
description: Its government cited deteriorating conditions in the camps as reason for bringing the four women and 10 children home.

title: Doctors reveal Italy’s Berlusconi diagnosed with leukaemia
description: Doctors did not specify when the blood cancer was first spotted, saying only that it is not acute.

title: Vietnam to probe TikTok over ‘toxic’ content
description: The app faces growing pressure from Western governments over fears that user data could be used by Chinese officials.

title: Azerbaijan expels four Iranian diplomats amid rising tensions
description: Azeri foreign ministry says four embassy employees were carrying out activities 'incompatible with diplomatic status'.

title: World champions Argentina return to top of FIFA rankings
description: La Albiceleste return to the summit after a gap of six years. France are second while Brazil fall to third.

title: Biden must not bring back ‘baby jails’
description: Family detention centres abuse human rights. To return to them would be on the US.

title: Twenty-five years on: The legacy of the Good Friday Agreement
description: Politicians and experts reflect on the deal credited with ending 30 years of violence in Northern Ireland.

title: In southern Ethiopia, drought kills livestock and brings hunger
description: Nearly 12 million people, a 10th of the population, are at risk of famine in Ethiopia's drought-affected areas.

title: Finland’s long-held neutrality is over. What next?
description: Russia has sounded the alarm, but analysts say a Moscow-Helsinki conflict is unlikely.

title: Tennessee Republicans vote on expelling Democrats for gun protest
description: Vote takes place days after deadly Nashville school shooting, with advocates calling possible ousting 'undemocratic'.

title: Middle East round-up: Israeli forces storm Al-Aqsa Mosque
description: Here’s a round-up of Al Jazeera’s Middle East coverage this week.

title: Japanese Black Hawk helicopter missing with 10 on board
description: The helicopter reportedly disappeared from radar tracking after leaving a Ground Self Defence Force base on Miyakojima.

title: Taliban top spokesman Mujahid asked to work from Kandahar
description: Zabihullah Mujahid to split work between Kandahar and Kabul in a move seen as assertion of control by the Taliban chief.

title: Israeli forces attack Palestinians in Al-Aqsa for second time
description: Israeli police fire rubber bullets at Palestinian worshippers in a second raid on the Al-Aqsa Mosque compound.

title: Pakistan parliament rejects court order for snap provincial polls
description: Lawyer from opposition leader Imran Khan's party says resolution passed by MPs carries 'no backing of the law'.

title: ‘Merchanting’: The code word for the gold mafia’s plunder
description: In Al Jazeera's investigative series Gold Mafia, merchanting is used to launder money. But what exactly is merchanting?

title: Is the stratosphere up for a gold rush?
description: A new generation of companies wants to use large, uncrewed aircraft to beam down 5G signals and keep an eye on Earth.

title: Gabon ends search mission for missing ferry passengers
description: Seven people are still missing after a boat capsized on March 9, killing 30 passengers.

title: France implores China to ‘bring Russia to its senses’ on Ukraine
description: France's president, accompanied by the European Commission chief, says he wants to 'be a voice that unites Europe'.

title: Swiss gold or smuggled Zimbabwean gold? No one knows
description: A complex gold smuggling and trading system means there is no clean gold, an Al Jazeera investigation shows. Here's why.

title: Israel intercepts rocket fire from southern Lebanon: Military
description: Second rocket was also launched from southern Lebanon, according to local media reports, after Israeli raid on Al-Aqsa.

title: What draws the gold mafia to ‘Dubai, Dubai, Dubai’?
description: An Al Jazeera investigation shows how criminals use the city’s pro-business policies to smuggle gold, clean dirty cash.

title: Genesis, a dark web marketplace, shut down in global operation
description: The service hosted about 80 million credentials and digital fingerprints stolen from more than two million people.

title: My undergrads struggle to read – I think I know why
description: Thanks to the likes of TikTok and Instagram, young people are experiencing a devastating crisis of attention.

title: Making the best of Ramadan in quake-hit northwestern Syria
description: Aid groups provide community iftar meals to help people displaced by war and earthquakes as food prices surge.

title: Call for protests in Sudan as deal on civilian rule delayed again
description: Second delay of signing ceremony in a week due to disputes between army and Rapid Support Forces paramilitary group.

title: Rohingya VJs: Undercover in Myanmar
description: 101 East reveals exclusive secret footage from inside an apartheid state.

title: Uganda’s public prosecutor to charge minister over corruption
description: The Ugandan cabinet minister is to be charged for mismanagement of the distribution of metal roofing sheets.

title: Wagner advances in Bakhmut as Ukraine gears up for counterattack
description: Russian mercenaries say they have seized the centre of Bakhmut as Ukraine's troops train for new offensives.

title: What’s next for Trump and the Republican Party?
description: After a landmark indictment in New York, can the former US president beat the accusations against him?

title: Young Plato: Transforming young lives through philosophy
description: A headmaster in Belfast’s Ardoyne community invokes the wisdom of philosophers to help children deal with conflict.

title: Robert F Kennedy Jr to challenge Biden for Democratic nomination
description: Kennedy Jr, an anti-vaccine activist and scion of one of the country’s most famous families, is running for president.

title: Saudi Arabia, Iran agree to continue efforts to establish ties
description: The two countries' top diplomats agree to resume flights, officials' visits and to facilitate visas for citizens.

title: Kazakh official: Not the time to resolve differences through war
description: Roman Vassilenko, Kazakhstan's deputy foreign minister, calls for diplomacy to end the Russia-Ukraine war.

title: How are humanitarian workers faring in Turkey and Syria?
description: As earthquake recovery continues, humanitarian workers process their own losses and trauma.

title: India central bank surprises by holding rates steady
description: The central bank decided to pause rate hikes in light of global macroeconomic and financial conditions, it said.

title: How India’s ‘brown beauty’ makeup influencers are going global
description: Indian makeup maven Debasree Banerjee has found fans across the world with a simple philosophy: brown is beautiful.

title: Indonesia’s Telkomsel agrees to $3.9bn merger with broadband arm
description: Move comes as the telecom looks to expand in Indonesia's fixed broadband market.

title: Foreign ministers of Iran, Saudi Arabia meet in China
description: The meeting – the first of the two countries' most senior diplomats in seven years – follows a March rapprochement.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 407
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 407th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Cash App founder stabbed to death in San Francisco
description: US tech leaders pay tribute to 'force of nature' Bob Lee after news of tech entrepreneur's killing.

title: China aircraft carrier in drills near Taiwan amid rising tension
description: Shandong carrier reported off east coast as Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen flies home after meeting US House Speaker.

title: Formula 1 in the skies: the key to making flying cars a reality?
description: Alauda Aeronautics hopes the world’s first flying car race will make futuristic vehicles an everyday reality.

title: ‘Brink of nuclear war’: North Korea warning on military drills
description: Pyongyang's state media publishes warning as United States and South Korea continue joint military exercises.

title: US progressives galvanised by victory in Chicago mayoral race
description: Progressive Brandon Johnson narrowly defeated the more conservative Democrat Paul Vallas in a highly-anticipated vote.
